docs.snippet: As consumer packaged goods companies cut advertising spending, WPP said it expected net sales for the year would be flat to up 1 percent.

headline.print_headline: WPP Lowers Forecast as Advertisers Cut Back
headline.main: Advertising Giant WPP Lowers Forecast as Clients Cut Back

docs.snippet: A.O. Scott and Manohla Dargis rank the best films made since 2000.

headline.main: The 25 Best Films of the 21st Century So Far.

docs.snippet: Women Photograph, a new organization dedicated to helping female visual journalists address obstacles in photojournalism, has announced the recipients of its first grants to support personal projects.

headline.main: No Longer Seeing the World Through Men’s Eyes

docs.abstract: Women Photograph, a new organization dedicated to helping female visual journalists address obstacles in photojournalism, has announced the recipients of its first grants to support personal projects.

docs.snippet: Already prevalent online, shorter ads are seen as a way to address shorter attention spans, and eventually reduce the length of commercial breaks.

docs.snippet: Kirill S. Serebrennikov leads the Gogol Center, one of the most prominent and progressive artistic venues in Moscow.

docs.snippet: Dionne Searcey says that even with sometimes spotty internet connectivity, West Africans have embraced smartphones and apps like WhatsApp and Skype.

docs.snippet: A social media campaign is looking to change a custom in which men traditionally use substitutes for women’s actual names in public, like My Weak One or My Goat.

headline.main: Their Identities Denied, Afghan Women Ask, ‘Where Is My Name?’

docs.snippet: Today is all about the eclipse, and there’s a viewing option for almost anyone. Elsewhere, Acorn TV heads to India with an escapist medical melodrama.
